business.headline: Gold price today: How much is 24 carat gold in metro cities?The increase comes as the global gold market reacts to a weaker US dollar and rising geopolitical tensions, particularly between Russia and Ukraine.

RBI warns public about deepfake videos of top officials giving financial adviceIn a press release, the central bank clarified that these videos are fake and warned people not to engage with or believe in them.

Can cryptocurrency be the next gold? With strong support and remarkable returns, Bitcoin is now increasingly seen as a potential alternative to gold, despite its volatility and regulatory challenges.

Nirmala Sitharaman calls for 'affordable' interest rates after Piyush GoyalThe Reserve Bank of India's (RBI) Monetary Policy Committee (MPC) has kept key interest rates unchanged since February 2023, citing persistent inflation pressures.

Sensex surges 1,000 points, snaps 7-session losing streak. Is the worst over?Sensex today: At 11:36 am, the Sensex was up 1044.89 points at 78,383.90, while the NSE Nifty50 advanced 304.50 points to 23,758.30.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Maharashtra, Jharkhand vote in NDA vs INDIA battle Live UpdatesIn Maharashtra, a total of 4,136 candidates are contesting across 288 constituencies. While in Jharkhand, more than 500 candidates, including Chief Minister Hemant Soren and his wife Kalpana Soren, are contesting in 38 of the total 81 Assembly seats.

Journalist killed in BMW hit-and-run in Chennai, body thrown 100 m on impactA Telugu channel video journalist in Chennai was killed when he was hit by a speeding luxury car on an elevated highway. Such was the impact that he was thrown 100 m away from the accident spot.

US embassy in Kyiv closes due to air threat amid Russia-Ukraine escalationIn a statement, the US embassy announced a temporary closure. US citizens in Ukraine were also advised to prepare for potential air raid alerts and take necessary precautions.

I know you, you are very famous: Indonesian President praises JaishankarThe External Affairs Minister received warm compliments from Indonesian President Prabowo Subianto as he and PM Narendra Modi arrived for a bilateral meeting on the sidelines of the G20 Summit.

As Maharashtra votes, 7 big factors that could swing the election decisivelyMaharashtra is a big state and the Assembly election issues are diverse. As Maharashtra votes today, here's a look at seven big factors, from OBC consolidation, Maratha votes to BJP-Congress direct fights, that could swing the poll decisively.

Biden front and centre as world leaders retake G20 family photoG20 Summit in Brazil: After missing the G20 family shot on Monday, US President Joe Biden was given a spot near the middle of the front row of the assembled world leaders as they retook the photo.

Kangana Ranaut praises Aryan Khan for choosing direction over actingKangana Ranaut praised Aryan Khan's choice to direct instead of acting. Shah Rukh Khan and Karan Johar also celebrated his debut as a director for an upcoming Netflix series, tentatively titled, Stardom.

Italian village offers $1 homes to Americans looking to relocate after Trump winOllolai, a small, picturesque village in Italy is making headlines with an unusual pitch to Americans seeking an escape after Donald Trump's re-election: homes for as little as one euro ($1.06).

Did Delhi's AQI exceed 1,500? Decoding conflicting air pollution readings The CPCB, India's official environmental watchdog, caps AQI readings at a maximum of 500, which signifies "severe" pollution levels. In contrast, international platforms often report AQI values exceeding 1,000 for the same locations, leaving the public perplexed.

Elon Musk roasts Jaguar over new logo. See British carmaker's response   Jaguar New Logo: Jaguar shared their rebrand video with the caption, "Copy nothing," showcasing a 30-second advert that focuses on vibrant visuals rather than vehicles.

Women's toilet on Capitol Hill is latest flashpoint in US battle of gendersIn a bill aimed specifically at Democrat Sarah McBride, the first transgender person in Congress, Republican Nancy Mace proposed prohibiting any lawmakers from "using single-sex facilities other than those corresponding to their biological sex".

Not my voice, fake messages: Supriya Sule denies 'crypto funds for polls' chargeSupriya Sule on 'Bitcoin Scam' Allegations: The NCP (SP) leader dismissed the allegations a day after BJP's Sudhanshu Trivedi played audio clips at a presser, accusing Supriya Sule and Maharashtra Congress chief Nana Patole of indulging in illegal bitcoin transactions to change the results of the Assembly polls.

The results leave Argentina close to World Cup qualification, with Brazil under pressure to secure their spot.

The Dutchman took an hour and 52 minutes to beat the Spanish legend.

Champions Trophy 2025 tour begins in Pakistan despite hosting uncertaintyThe trophy tour of the ICC Champions Trophy 2025 has begun in Pakistan despite the uncertainty over the hosting of the complete tournament in the country due to India's reluctance to travel to Pakistan.

Can play as a specialist batter: Shastri lauds Jurel's temperament AUS vs IND: Ravi Shastri has backed Dhruv Jurel to play as a specialist batter ahead of India's five-match Test series against Australia, starting November 22 at the Perth Stadium.

Watch: Rafael Nadal gets emotional during national anthem in Davis Cup quartersLegendary Tennis player Rafael Nadal was seen getting emotional during the Spanish national anthem ahead of his quarter final game against Netherlands' Botic van de Zandschulp in the Davis Cup.

Rafael Nadal Farewell Highlights: Botic van de Zandschulp beats Nadal 6-4, 6-4Davis Cup Finals Highlights: Botic van de Zandschulp beat Rafael Nadal 6-4, 6-4 in the quarterfinal clash in Malaga. It was just the second loss for the Spaniard in  Davis Cup and his first since 2004.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
